alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 11 at 4:01PM EDT until July 11 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Jackson County in the panhandle of Florida... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 301 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Marianna, Cottondale, Grand Ridge, Greenwood, Chipola Terrace, Marianna Municipal A/P, Blue Spring, Dellwood, Cypress and Cottondale Airport. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
